titlStmt.titl: Vitamin D and K Status Influences Bone Mineral Density and Bone Accrual in Children and Adolescents with Celiac Disease

citation.biblCit: Mager, Diana; Turner, Justine; Qiao, Jing, 2016, "Vitamin D and K Status Influences Bone Mineral Density and Bone Accrual in Children and Adolescents with Celiac Disease", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10912, UAL Dataverse, V2

titlStmt.titl: Vitamin D and K Status Influences Bone Mineral Density and Bone Accrual in Children and Adolescents with Celiac Disease

stdyInfo.abstract: The study objective was to determine the interrelationships between vitamin K/D status and lifestyle variables on bone mineral density) in children and adolescents with celiac disease at diagnosis and after 1 year on the gluten-free diet.

sumDscr.dataKind: BMD data; Anthropometric data, dietary and physical activity; Biosamples
sumDscr.universe: Children and adolescents aged 3-17 years with biopsy proven celiac disease.

dataColl.frequenc: Blood was collected at baseline and 1 year later.
dataColl.sampProc: There were 43 participants, who were chosen through convenience sample.
dataColl.collMode: Pen and paper face-to-face interview; Self-administered questionnaire: Paper; Self-administered writings and/or diaries; Physical measurements and tests
dataColl.cleanOps: The study team was trained in data entry and had an established standard operating procedure (SOP) around auditing data.

useStmt.conditions: Access to the data is limited to selected members of the research team.

citation.biblCit: Mager, DR, Qiao J, Turner J. Vitamin D and K status influences bone mineral density and bone accrual in children and adolescents with celiac disease. European Journal of Clinical Nutrition (2012) 66, 488-495.
